articles.name: Single Nanodegree FAQs
articles.title: Single Nanodegree FAQs
articles.body:
General Questions

What is a Single Nanodegree Program?

A Single Nanodegree program is a one-time purchase that grants you access to a specific Udacity program and its resources for up to one year from the date of purchase, allowing you to learn at your own pace without ongoing subscription fees.

How is a Single Nanodegree Program Different from an All Access Subscription?

The Single Nanodegree program gives you access to just one specific program for a one-time fee, while the All Access subscription provides unlimited access to Udacity's entire catalog of programs for a monthly payment. Additionally, in an All Access subscription, you get exclusive access to career courses and personalized career services such as resume, LinkedIn profile, GitHub and Cover Letter reviews.

Is the Single Nanodegree Option Available for All Programs?

Currently, the Single Nanodegree option is limited to select programs in the pilot phase, with plans to expand availability in the future.

What Support is Available with a Single Nanodegree Program?

You will have access to the same mentor support, and personalized project reviews that come with the program, just like in the subscription model.

Can I Purchase Multiple Single Nanodegree Programs?

Yes, you may purchase multiple Single Nanodegree programs, but each Nanodegree program must be purchased separately. However, if you're interested in accessing a range of programs, the All Access subscription is a better option as it provides unlimited access to all of our programs.

 

Switching Between Plans

Can I Switch from an All Access Subscription to a Single Nanodegree Program?

Yes, however switching from an All Access subscription to a Single Nanodegree program is not automatic. You will need to cancel your All Access subscription and then purchase the Single Nanodegree program separately. Please note that you can only receive a refund if you cancel within the refund period. If you cancel after this period, no partial credit or refund will be provided for the remaining time on your subscription.

Can I Switch from a Single Nanodegree Program to an All Access Subscription?

To switch from a Single Nanodegree program to an All Access subscription, you’ll need to cancel your Single enrollment and then sign up for All Access. Keep in mind that if you're outside of the refund period for your Single Nanodegree program, you won’t receive a partial refund or credit for the switch. You will have access to all content while your All Access subscription is active, and if you cancel your subscription, you will still retain access to the original Single Nanodegree program you purchased for up to a year.

What Happens to My Progress if I Switch to All Access?

Your progress is saved, and you can continue where you left off in the Nanodegree program. Additionally, you’ll gain access to the rest of Udacity’s course catalog.

Can I Purchase a Single Nanodegree Program if I Have an All Access Subscription?

Yes. However, you can purchase a Single Nanodegree program without needing to cancel your All Access subscription. You can have both at the same time, if you wish to purchase a specific program with one year of access while still enjoying the benefits of All Access.

 

Payments and Refunds

Can I Get a Refund on a Single Nanodegree Program Purchase?

Yes, if you're unsatisfied and request a refund within the refund window, you will receive a full refund. After this period, refunds are not available. Additionally, if you try to repurchase the same Single Nanodegree program again after canceling, you will be ineligible for a refund on the second purchase.

What Happens if I Cancel My Single Nanodegree Program Enrollment?

Canceling within the refund period results in a full refund and removal of course access.

Does a Personalized Offer Apply to Single Nanodegree Purchases?

Yes, personal offers can be used for Single Nanodegree purchases.

 

Course Content and Access

Will I Receive Content Updates with a Single Nanodegree Program?

Yes, if you’re enrolled in a Single Nanodegree program, you will get automatic updates to any minor updates like bug fixes and improvements for a year. Additionally, if an updated version of the content is released while you're actively enrolled, you’ll see a banner in the classroom offering the option to upgrade. Keep in mind that choosing to upgrade will reset your progress in the current version, and you'll need to start over with the new content. A support document and warning will appear to guide you through this process before you proceed.

Can I Access Career Services with a Single Nanodegree Program?

Career Services are only provided to learners who join Udacity's All Access subscriptions. These services include resume, LinkedIn profile, GitHub and Cover Letter reviews.

What Happens if I Switch from All Access to a Single Nanodegree Program?

If you switch from All Access to a Single Nanodegree program, you will retain access to the course content and projects for the specific program you’ve purchased. However, you’ll lose access to career services as those are only available through the All Access subscription.

Do I Get the Same Projects and Certification?

Yes, you will have full access to all the projects and receive the same verified certification upon completing the Nanodegree program, regardless of whether it’s through a Single purchase or subscription.

Will I Join the Learners’ Community with a Single Nanodegree Program?

Yes, once you’re enrolled, you'll receive an email inviting you to join the learners' community where you can connect with like-minded individuals from around the world, ask questions, share experiences, and participate in events designed to enrich your learning experience.

What if My Program is Deprecated?

If you're enrolled in a program that has a new major version release where the old content is being deprecated, you will be notified of the change in advance to either upgrade to the new version (losing progress) or complete any progress and graduate before the old version's unenrollment date. In rare cases, we may choose to deprecate a Nanodegree program and not replace it with a new version. If that should happen, we will notify you about the deprecation and give you [insert time] to complete the program.

How Do 3rd Party Tools Operate in the Single Nanodegree Model?

3rd party tools like Labs and GPU hours remain within their defined usage limits. Flexibility to complete the program in your own time does not imply unlimited usgae of tools.

 

Post-Graduation Access

Will I Have Access to Course Materials After Graduation?

After graduating from a Single Nanodegree program, you will continue to have access to the course materials, including lessons, quizzes, and you’ll be able to view previously submitted projects for up to a year from the date of purchase. If you have an All Access subscription, access will remain available until you cancel your subscription.

Will Career Services Be Available After Graduation?

Career services are not available to learners enrolled in a Single program.

Can I Participate in Community Discussions After Graduation?

Yes, as a graduate, you'll receive ongoing access to the Alumni community, including access to different spaces, discussions, and events on the community platform. This allows you to continue engaging with fellow learners and alumni, share insights, and stay connected even after graduation.

Will I Have Mentor Access After Graduation?

Mentorship is active only during enrollment. Post-graduation support is available via community forums.

Will Labs and GPU Resources Be Available Post-Graduation?

No, access to labs and GPU resources ends upon graduation.

Will I Receive Future Course Updates After Graduation?

Yes, after graduating from a Single Nanodegree program, you’ll have the option to access future versions of the content if you wish to learn the updated material.

 

Technical Support

What if I Encounter Technical Issues?

Udacity’s support and community teams are available to assist during your enrollment.

How Do I Access My Program After Purchase?

Log in to your Udacity account to access the program under your dashboard. There are no start or completion time limits.

articles.name: Scholarship Opportunities
articles.title: Scholarship Opportunities
articles.body:
Our Scholarships team offers dedicated programs in partnership with industry leaders and other community organisations. Currently, we do not provide Scholarships directly on an individual enrollment basis.

 

If you’d like to learn about ongoing and upcoming scholarship programs, kindly visit our Scholarships Webpage. You can also sign up to get notified of future scholarship opportunities by filling out the information requested under the “notify me” section.

 

We would also highly encourage you to seek out scholarship and grant opportunities in the area you live in. Keep an eye on our social media presence and be sure you're getting our newsletters - we do provide promotional discount offers from time to time. 

 

Additionally, you can explore our range of free courses available here. These courses can provide valuable learning opportunities as you await scholarship openings.

articles.name: Pausing Subscription
articles.title: Pausing Subscription
articles.body:
What does ‘pausing’ subscription mean?

  • With subscription pausing, you can temporarily suspend your subscription without canceling it entirely. During the pause period, you will not be billed or have access to your enrolled programs. The subscription automatically resumes once the pause period ends and billing continues as usual.

For how long can I pause my subscription?

  • Currently, you can pause your subscription for one to three months.

Where can I see the ‘pause’ option on my account?

  • You will be able to see the ‘Pause Subscription’ button right above the ‘Cancel Subscription’ button on your Subscription page

Will I lose access to my Nanodegree/ course content once I pause my subscription?

  • Yes, you will lose access to classroom content once your pause period begins. 

Will I lose my classroom progress if I pause my subscription?

  • No, your classroom progress will be saved during the pause. When you resume your subscription, you can pick up where you left off.

Can I resume my subscription early?

  • Yes, you can resume your paused subscription anytime by clicking the Resume Subscription button on the Subscription Page.

How can I make sure that my subscription is paused?

  • Once you click on ‘Pause Subscription’, you will be able to see ‘Paused’ in your ‘Individual Plan’ section on your Subscription page

Will pausing my subscription affect my current billing period?

  • No, there will be no changes to your current billing period. The pause will take effect at the end of your current billing period.

Can I cancel my subscription during the pause period?

  • Yes, if you wish to cancel your subscription during your period, you will be able to do so by clicking on ‘Cancel Subscription’ next to ‘Resume Subscription’ on your Subscription page

What happens if I resume my subscription before my current billing period ends? 

  • If your subscription is scheduled to be paused, clicking the Resume button removes the schedule. Following the removal, your subscription will automatically renew at the end of your current billing period.

What happens if I resume my paused subscription? 

  • If you resume your paused subscription before its scheduled end date, you will be charged immediately for the billing period following the resume date. Your subscription benefits will be restored immediately

What happens if I don’t restart my subscription after 60 days?

  • If you don’t take any action after 60 days of the pause period, your subscription will be renewed automatically and the saved payment methods will be charged to restart your subscription

Can I extend the pause duration?

  • At this time, you cannot extend the resume date after the pause has started.

articles.name: What is Plagiarism?
articles.title: What is Plagiarism?
articles.body:
Plagiarism is any act claiming or implying another person’s work is your own. Plagiarism at Udacity can range from submitting a project you didn’t create to copying code into a program without citation. Any action in which you misleadingly claim an idea or piece of work as your own when it is not constitutes plagiarism.


The below are some coding-specific examples of what constitutes plagiarism on the Udacity platform and what Udacity considers to be acceptable behavior, as well as some guidelines for submitting original work. While specific to coding, the below concepts can also apply to written content, images, UI designs, and other content created by another person. Please also note that these examples are not meant to be exhaustive, and Udacity reserves the right to take action, as it deems appropriate, if it appears that your submission is, in any way, not your own work.

Examples of plagiarism:

  • Copying someone’s code exactly, in whole or part (verbatim).
  • Combining code copied verbatim from multiple sources.
  • Copying someone’s code, in whole or part, and making changes (e.g. changing variable or function names, comments, order of function definition).
  • Two or more students who work on a project together and end up with the identical code submission, or significant portions of their submissions show duplicated code.

Not Plagiarism:

  • Looking at someone else’s code to get a general idea of implementation, then putting it away and starting to write your own code from scratch.
  • Copying code or using code that has been provided for you and approved for use in your project by Udacity without attribution.
  • Two or more students who discuss a project together to get a general idea of implementation, then separate to each write their own code individually.
  • Using or adapting and then properly attributing (give date and URL) a small piece of helper code, either open source or written by someone else who has provided their consent to such use and/or adaptation. The helper code must not be directly relevant to the concepts being assessed in your assignment.

articles.name: Video Transcripts
articles.title: Video Transcripts
articles.body:
What do you think of Udacity's Video Transcripts? We would love to hear from you. Provide feedback

 

Welcome to our guide on Udacity's video transcript feature. This feature is designed to enhance your learning experience by allowing you to read and interact with the transcript of your video content in real time. Below, we’ll walk you through the features and how to make the most of them.

Features of the Video Transcript

  1. View the Transcript in Real Time

    • As you watch the video, you can see the transcript of what’s being said displayed in real time. This helps you follow along more easily, especially if you prefer reading to listening.

  2. Search the Transcript

    • You can quickly find key information within the transcript using your browser’s search feature. Simply press Ctrl+F (Windows) or Cmd+F (Mac) and type in the keyword you’re looking for. Your browser will highlight all instances of that word or phrase in the transcript.

  3. Jump to a Specific Location in the Video

    • At any time, you can click on a portion of the transcript to jump to that exact point in the video. This way, you can quickly review specific parts of the content without having to manually scrub through the video timeline.

  4. Toggle the Transcript

    • You can easily show or hide the transcript according to your preference. Use the Show Transcript and Hide Transcript options to control the visibility of the transcript on your screen.

How to Use the Transcript Feature

Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to use each feature:

  1. Viewing the Transcript

    • The transcript will automatically appear below the video player. You don’t need to do anything extra to start seeing the real-time transcript.

  2. Searching the Transcript

    • While the transcript is open, press Ctrl+F or Cmd+F on your keyboard.
    • A search bar will appear in your browser. Type in the word or phrase you’re looking for.
    • Your browser will highlight all occurrences of the search term within the transcript.

  3. Clicking to Jump to Video Sections

    • Scan through the transcript as the video plays or pause the video to review the transcript.
    • Click on any part of the transcript text, and the video will automatically jump to that section.

  4. Toggling the Transcript Visibility

    • Look for the Show Transcript or Hide Transcript option under the video player.
    • Click Show Transcript to display the transcript.
    • Click Hide Transcript to remove the transcript from view.

We hope this feature enhances your learning experience! If you have any questions or encounter any issues, please don’t hesitate to reach out to our support team.

Happy Learning!

---

What do you think of Udacity's Video Transcripts? We would love to hear from you. Provide feedback

articles.name: Difference between older major versions 1-10 and the new major version 11 of AI Programming with Python Nanodegree Program
articles.title: Difference between older major versions 1-10 and the new major version 11 of AI Programming with Python Nanodegree Program
articles.body:
We have made two major revisions to keep ahead of the changing requirements of AI Programming with Python (nd089) development.

What’s new

  • Refreshed lessons (exercises, text, and quizzes) in the Introduction to Python for AI
  • Programmers to include more of a focus on AI
  • A completely new course on Programming Transformer Neural Networks with PyTorch

Who can benefit from this new course?

  • This beginner-level program is for individuals with basic Python programming knowledge and an understanding of elementary algebra who want to further their experience developing Python and AI / ML.

How long should it take to complete the program?

  • This program is estimated to take 30 hours total. It will take you approximately 3-4 weeks to complete if you spend an average of 10 hours per week.

What if I already took the older AI Programming with Python program ? 

  • You can still update to the latest version by clicking the button pictured below.

Why should I take the updated AI Programming with Python program?

  • This program is for individuals who want to further enhance their AI programming experience with Python.

How do I enroll in the updated AI Programming with Python program?

  • In the Classroom, you’ll see a banner with an action to enroll you in the updated version.

 

Will I get a new certificate for the updated version?

  • Yes, after finishing the updated pieces of the program you will receive a new certificate.

What happens when I enroll in the new program?

  • By updating your enrollment to the new version your previous enrollment will be replaced with the new enrollment. This will effectively remove your previous enrollment and all associated progress for the two updated courses. This means that your classroom progress for Introduction to Python for AI Programmers will be reset and you will also have access to the new course on Programming Transformer Neural Networks with PyTorch.

articles.name: 7 day Free Trial
articles.title: 7 day Free Trial
articles.body:
Is the free trial available worldwide?

  • Currently, the free trial is only available in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Germany, Italy, Spain, Turkey, and United Kingdom but our goal is to offer it to all Udacity participating regions in the near future. Stay tuned for updates on availability in your region.

Do I need to provide payment information to start the free trial?

  • Yes, you will need to enter your payment details to begin the free trial, but you will not be charged until the trial period ends. Once the free trial has expired you will be auto-renewed at the standard monthly rate.

Why was I charged $10 for the free trial?

  • The $10 charge is a pre-authorization hold, also known as a pre-auth hold, which is a temporary hold placed on funds in a payment account to ensure that the account has sufficient funds available for an upcoming transaction. The hold will automatically drop in a few days.

When does the 7-day free trial start?

  • The trial starts as soon as you sign up and receive confirmation of enrollment.

What is the duration of the free trial?

  • The free trial lasts for 7-days, after which it automatically rolls over into a monthly subscription unless canceled during the trial period.

How do I cancel my free trial?

  • You can cancel your free trial at any time before it ends by going to your account settings and selecting the cancellation option.

What happens if I cancel my subscription during the free trial?

  • If you cancel your subscription during the free trial period, your payment instrument will not be charged, and no rollover will be attempted at the end of the trial period.

Can I get a refund if I forget to cancel my free trial?

  • Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds for the free trial. It is important to cancel before the trial period ends to avoid charges.

Can I use a coupon or discount code during the free trial?

  • Yes, you can use a coupon or discount code during the free trial. The discounted price will apply to the subsequent charges if you do not cancel during the free trial period.

I received a message stating I am not eligible for the free trial. Why is that?

  • We evaluate our free trial eligibility offerings from time to time. The trial's frequency may be limited for each account. Some payment cards, such as prepaid ones, cannot be used for trials.

Are there any restrictions on content during the free-trial?

  • No, there are no limitations. The free trial provides full access to all course materials, including video lectures, projects, mentor support, and quizzes, just like a paid subscription.

Can I restart my free trial if I encounter issues and have to cancel?

  • Free trials are limited to one per user. If you encounter issues, please contact support to resolve them rather than canceling.

Can I share my free trial with others?

  • No, the free trial is intended for individual use and cannot be shared with others.

How are customer referrals handled during the free trial?

  • Referral credits are not applied until the referred customer converts to a paid subscriber. Customers who refer others using the free trial promo codes will receive credit once the referred customer's subscription is active.

What should I do if I encounter technical issues during the trial?

  • Please reach out to Udacity Support through this quick form or write to us at support@udacity.com

articles.name: Difference between previous iOS Developer and the new iOS Development SwiftUI and SwiftData Nanodegree Program
articles.title: Difference between previous iOS Developer and the new iOS Development SwiftUI and SwiftData Nanodegree Program
articles.body:
Since the original iOS Developer Nanodegree program launched in March 2015, we have made 5 major revisions to keep ahead of the changing requirements of iOS application development.

What’s new

  • All new Content. No content from the previous version was used. 
  • All content is created for iOS 17 and Xcode 15 (2023-2024 releases)
  • New course and project on Swift programming language
  • New course and project on SwiftUI
  • New course and project on SwiftData
  • New course and project on Networking and Concurrency in iOS 
  • New course and project on planning and publishing iOS projects

Learners will have the opportunity to work on real-world projects designed by industry experts to build their portfolio of skills and learn core skills sets to prepare them for a career of the future.

Who can benefit from this new course?

  • This intermediate-level program is for individuals with basic computer programming knowledge who want to further their experience programming with Swift, working in the SwiftUI, and with Swift Data.

How long should it take to complete the program?

  • This program is estimated to take 5 months to complete if you spend an average of 10 hours a week.

What if I already took the iOS Developer ND? 

  • You can still update to the latest version by clicking the button pictured below.

Why should I take the new iOS Development with SwiftUI and SwiftData Nanodegree program?

  • This program is for individuals who want to further their experience programming with Swift, working in SwiftUI, and with Swift Data, and coding for iOS 17 and Xcode 15 (2023-2024 releases).

How do I enroll in the new iOS Development with SwiftUI and SwiftData Nanodegree program?

  • In the Classroom, you’ll see a banner with an action to enroll you in the updated version.

 

Will I get a new certificate for the updated version?

  • Yes, after finishing the updated program you will receive a new certificate.

What happens when I enroll in the new program?

  • By updating your enrollment to the new version your previous enrollment will be replaced with the new enrollment. This will effectively remove your previous enrollment and all associated progress. This means that your classroom progress will be reset and you will not be able to see your older progress in the classroom

articles.name: Dashboard
articles.title: Dashboard
articles.body:
Welcome to Your New Personalized Dashboard

Overview

At Udacity, we always strive to enhance your learning experience. Our new Personalized Dashboard is designed to help you continue your learning journey seamlessly, track your progress, and receive AI-generated course recommendations tailored to your career goals. This feature-rich dashboard is your centralized hub for all things learning-related, helping you stay organized and motivated.

Key Features

1. Continue Learning

The Dashboard is designed to make it easy for you to pick up right where you left off. The Continue Learning section showcases the Nanodegrees and Courses you have viewed, with your most recently accessed program first. This ensures you spend less time navigating and more time learning.

2. Track Your Progress

Keeping track of your progress is crucial to staying motivated and on target. Your Personalized Dashboard includes:

  • Lessons Viewed: How many lessons you have completed across your Udacity course/courses.
  • Concepts Viewed: How many concepts you have viewed. (Concepts are pages within Lessons)
  • Quizzes Complete: How many quizzes you have finished.
  • Programs Completed: How many Nanodegrees or Courses you have completed.
  • Projects Passed: How many projects you have passed.

3. Recommended For You

Our dashboard leverages AI to provide personalized course recommendations based on your learning history and career objectives. These courses are tailored to help you bridge any knowledge gaps and keep you on track for your desired career path.

4. Newest Programs

Keeping your skills up-to-date is critical in the fast-evolving tech landscape. The "Newest Programs" section highlights the latest courses and nanodegrees added to Udacity, ensuring you have access to the most current and relevant content.

How to Use the Dashboard

Navigating the Dashboard

  • Home Screen: Once you log in, you'll be directed to the Dashboard home screen.
  • Sections Overview: The main sections such as "Continue Learning," "Recommended For You," and "Newest Programs" are easy to navigate with clear labels.
  • Progress Indicators: Check your progress in the right-hand panel.

Taking Action

  • Continue Learning: Click on any of the courses listed in this section to resume where you left off.
  • Enroll in Recommended Courses: If a recommended course catches your eye, simply click on it to find more details and enroll.
  • Explore New Programs: Click on a program in the "Newest Programs" section to read the course description, check prerequisites, and enroll.

Feedback

What do you think of the new design? We'd love to hear from you. Provide feedback

 

Feel free to contact us with any questions or feedback regarding the new Personalized Dashboard. We're here to support you every step of the way.

articles.name: Checkout Process
articles.title: Checkout Process
articles.body:
How do I purchase a Udacity bundle or subscription?

First step is to explore the catalog and find a program that interests you! Once you’ve determined where you’d like to begin your learning, navigate to the ‘Enroll Now’ button at the top of that program’s page.

From there, you are able to select which option you’d like to purchase: 

  • Month-to-month: Pay monthly for access to the entire catalog, including the program you’ve selected
  • 4 Months: Pay upfront for 4 months of access to the entire catalog, including the program you’ve selected, for a 15% discount

I’m receiving an error when attempting to checkout. What should I do next?

  • First, please ensure that you have successfully created an account with Udacity and have navigated to ‘Sign In.’ If you have not already created an account, you must first navigate to ‘Sign Up’ to create an account in order to successfully checkout.

  • Next, make sure that you have entered accurate information in the “email” field or have used a valid Google or Facebook ID to sign up.
  • Finally, click on 'Continue to Checkout' and you will be directed to the checkout page to complete your purchase.

If I’ve followed these steps, why am I still unable to access the checkout page?

If after following the steps outlined above, you are still unable to access the checkout page or receive an error similar to the one below on the checkout page itself, that means that Udacity’s paid services are not available in your country/region.

Can I still access Udacity's free content even if I'm unable to checkout?

Yes! Udacity’s free content is available to all. You can explore the catalog for free courses here.

articles.name: Spring 2024 Classroom Update
articles.title: Spring 2024 Classroom Update
articles.body:
The Classroom Update is designed to improve accessibility and ensure easy navigation within your Udacity course or Nanodegree.

🔹 Revamped Navigation Pane for seamless navigation to any lesson in your Nanodegree or Course without returning to the syllabus. 

 

🔹 Dedicated Resources Tab for quick and organized access to supplementary materials, including accessing your AWS Cloud Gateway.

 

To change Courses within a Nanodegree, use the Course selector above your Course title:

 

Lesson titles expand and collapse for easy navigation through your program:

 

All course resources, including AWS Cloud Gateway access, are conveniently housed in the Resources tab:

 

 

What do you think of the new design? We would love to hear from you. Provide feedback

articles.name: Learners Community: Connect, Learn, and Grow Together!
articles.title: Learners Community: Connect, Learn, and Grow Together!
articles.body:
Learners Community is a dedicated space where you can connect with peers, access valuable resources, and enhance your learning experience. Here's everything you need to know to get started:

  1. Connect with Peers: The Learners Community provides a platform for you to connect with like-minded individuals who are also on their learning journey. Whether you're seeking study buddies, looking to share experiences, or simply want to engage in discussions, our community offers a supportive environment where you can connect with peers from around the world.

  2. Exclusive Events: Explore a range of community offerings designed to enrich your learning experience. From exclusive events featuring guest speakers to focused group study sessions and fun activities like community contests, there's something for everyone in the Learners Community.
  1. Access the Community: To access the Learners Community, simply visit the following link  https://community.udacity.com/ and create an account with your Udacity registered email for a seamless experience. Once logged in, you'll be able to explore all the community spaces, events, and resources available to you.

  2. If you encounter any issues or have questions about the Learners Community, don't hesitate to reach out to your dedicated community manager for assistance. We're here to help ensure your experience in the Learners Community is positive and enjoyable. Find your community managers here.

Whether you're looking to connect with peers, participate in events, or seek assistance, the Learners Community is here to support you every step of the way. Join the Learners Community and become part of our vibrant community of learners!

articles.name: 40% off First Month Offer
articles.title: 40% off First Month Offer
articles.body:
What’s the 40% off First Month offer?

  • For a limited time, you can enjoy a 40% discount on the first payment of your subscription. Take advantage of this offer by using the promo code FEB40 during checkout.

How long will the offer last? 

  • This offer is available for a limited time, redeemable from February 8th until February 16th, 2024. We encourage you to take advantage of this deal before it ends.

What does the 40% off First Month offer include? 

  • Your 40% off First Month provides access to all of our comprehensive programs, featuring a top-tier curriculum crafted in collaboration with industry leaders. Benefit from hands-on, project-based learning for practical job-ready skills. Enjoy dedicated support throughout your journey, including assistance with your initial project and 24/7 mentor availability. Professional project feedback and a wealth of resources are also part of this discounted package, ensuring a rewarding and supported learning experience.

Is the offer applicable to both monthly and bundle subscriptions? 

  • Yes, the offer is applicable to your first payment on either the monthly or bundle subscription plans.

How does the bundle subscription with this discount? 

  • Use code FEB40 at checkout to receive a 40% discount on your bundle subscription. The discount will discontinue when the bundle period expires. You can continue your subscription at the regular price after the initial bundle subscription ends.

Can I cancel my current enrollment and sign up again to avail this offer?

  • Unfortunately, this offer is applicable to new purchases only. Please note your current discount may apply to every month you are in the subscription. With the 40% off first month offer, you’ll pay the regular price after the first month is over. 

Can I share this code with others?

  • Yes, feel free to share the FEB40 code with your family and friends to use within the offer duration.

What will the price of my subscription be after the 40% off first month ends?

  • After your first  month is over, your subscription will be charged at our standard monthly subscription rate of $249/month.

Can I switch from monthly to bundle subscription with this offer?

  • If you’ve enrolled in a subscription during the period of this promotion, you are eligible to switch your subscription type from monthly to bundle. However, your pricing will revert to the list price once the subscription ends.

Can I combine my existing account with this deal?

  • Only one coupon can be applied to any subscription, so you’ll have to choose which of the discounts you’d rather take advantage of.

I missed this offer by a few days, can I still get it?

  • Unfortunately, the offer is only valid for redemption between February 8th and February 16th, 2024. If you missed the deadline, stay tuned for future promotions and opportunities.

articles.name: AWS Region Restriction
articles.title: AWS Region Restriction
articles.body:
Unless otherwise stated within your classroom exercises or projects, these are the enabled regions:

  • us-east-1
  • us-east-2
  • us-west-1
  • us-west-2 

If you are actively using resources outside of these regions, we highly recommend backing up these resources locally (e.g. SageMaker Notebooks, S3 Buckets, etc.) as otherwise your work may be affected and lost. 

How to backup your AWS resources:

To save data from your S3 Buckets: 

  1. Select the bucket that contains the files you want to keep 
  2. Click Download

To save your SageMaker Notebook: 

  1. Launch SageMaker Studio 
  2. Right-click the notebook or folder you want to keep 
  3. Click Copy Download Link 
  4. Paste the link into your browser’s address bar and it will begin downloading your selected files:

 

Kindly note, that some resources (e.g. RDS) will not be saveable and these will need to be redone in the enabled regions. Unfortunately, we will not be able to restore any work that may be lost due to this update.

Please find a list of all affected Nanodegree programs below:

  • Full Stack Web Developer
  • Full Stack JavaScript Developer
  • Data Engineering
  • Java Web Developer
  • Data Architect
  • AWS Cloud Architect
  • Machine Learning DevOps Engineer
  • Digital Freelancer
  • Site Reliability Engineer
  • Deep Learning
  • AWS Machine Learning Engineer
  • Hybrid Cloud Engineer
  • Cloud Developer
  • Cloud DevOps Engineer
  • Machine Learning Engineer Nanodegree

For AWS related questions, check out our Help Center articles here.

articles.name: Monitor AWS Usage and Billing
articles.title: Monitor AWS Usage and Billing
articles.body:
As a learner, you are provided with a limited budget and therefore it is important to monitor your consumption and usage so as to not exceed the budget that has been assigned to you in the classroom. 

See below for a video on viewing and monitoring your AWS Charges:

To monitor your AWS Usage, please follow the below steps: 

  1. Click the Open Cloud Console option under the Cloud Resources tab from your classroom lesson page to launch your AWS console:
  2. After clicking on Open Cloud Console, you will be redirected to a Federated AWS Account where you would be required to click on All Services and then AWS Cost Explorer
  3. After clicking on AWS Cost Explorer, you will be redirected to a new page where the current month's costs would be displayed:
  4. Click Cost Explorer on the left-hand side to choose the date range,
  5. Once you select the relevant dates, you will also have the option to select the costs (monthly or daily). You can then group by usage type, service, region, instance type, etc to further understand your usage details. 
  6. You can also access your bill which will include the detailed usage by clicking on the Budgets option on the left-hand side of your screen:
  7. Once you click on the Budgets option, please select Bills on the left-hand side:
  8. After clicking on Bills, you can then select the relevant month for which you want to view the AWS billing details:

articles.name: Redeeming Udacity Coupon/Promotional Code
articles.title: Redeeming Udacity Coupon/Promotional Code
articles.body:
See the steps below for instructions on redeeming a Udacity coupon/promotional code. 

  1. Navigate to: https://www.udacity.com/catalog
  2. Find your desired Nanodegree Program or Course
  3. Review the program page, and once you’re sure it’s the program you want, click the Enroll Now button.
  4. Click the Enroll Now button on the access play you prefer.

5. Before checking out, if you are not signed in you will be prompted to either sign in (if you have an existing Udacity account) or to enter your email address to sign-up (if you are a new user). 

6. After signing in, you’ll be directed to the checkout page. Input your unique coupon code under Add Discount Code. Then, apply the code. Please note that your unique coupon code can only be applied once.

 

7. As soon as you complete checkout, follow some basic onboarding steps and you are ready to begin your journey!

articles.name: Best Practices to Avoid Unexpected Microsoft Azure Charges
articles.title: Best Practices to Avoid Unexpected Microsoft Azure Charges
articles.body:
Verify Azure Costs

When you create your Azure account, you will be provided a $200 credit with no charge ONLY for 30 days. Please make sure to turn off the resources you’ve created after each exercise and project as you can very easily exceed your $200 limit.

Please use the Standard_B1s size for your VM, and you should be able to keep the AppService at the free tier with no problem.

Cost Management

Once you set up your Azure account, keep tabs on your Azure cost and ensure your costs don’t exceed what’s provided to you in the Azure free tier. To do so,

  • Choose a subscription (such as Pay-As-You-Go or Free tier)
  • View the Cost Analysis

This shows a cost breakdown of the resources in your subscription. Be sure to check this each day, especially if you are using Terraform to create resources. Also please enable Auto-shutdown for your VM by going to the Azure Portal > your VM > Operations > Auto-shutdown.

articles.name: FAQs for Courses
articles.title: FAQs for Courses
articles.body:
What is a single paid course?

  • Udacity's Nanodegree programs are a series of paid courses. Each paid course is a distinct unit of learning, typically ending in a project where students demonstrate mastery of the skills covered. On average, a learner can finish a course in one month, working 5-10 hours a week.

What is the difference between a Course and a Nanodegree Program and a Free Course?

Difference between a Course and a Nanodegree Program:

  • Udacity's Nanodegree programs are a series of paid courses. Each paid course is a distinct unit of learning, typically ending in a project where students demonstrate mastery of the skills covered. On average, a learner can finish a course in one month, working 5-10 hours a week.
  • Students who enroll in a paid course will receive all the same support and services as students in Udacity’s Nanodegree programs.

    The main differences are:

    1. A course is a smaller unit of material - a typical Nanodegree program is comprised of 3 or 4 courses
    2. Course learners will not have access to career-related content or projects.

Difference between a Free Course and Paid Course:

  • Every paid course includes project reviews from industry professionals, technical mentor support so you can get help when you need it, and a flexible learning plan so you can learn at your own pace.
  • Free courses are standalone courses that range in length and depth of material and do not include the real-world projects that come with paid courses and Nanodegree programs. Additionally, free courses do not have student support or technical mentor support included. We do not offer the option of earning a free certificate.

What is the payment form for courses?

  • Monthly Subscription

Do I get a Course graduation certificate if I complete a course?

  • Yes, Similar to Nanodegree programs, learners will have to complete all ‘required’ components to graduate (e.g. Project work). Upon graduation, learners will receive a graduation certificate link that is shareable for the course they have completed.

Do Courses count towards a Nanodegree program?

  • Yes, if a student completes a Course (and passes the associated project), and subsequently enrolls in a Nanodegree program that includes that Course, their completion of the Course will be reflected in the Nanodegree program.

Will I be able to get a job after completing a “ Paid Course”? 

  • While many of our Nanodegree programs and courses provide you with real-world skills needed within an applicable industry, there are many factors involved in the hiring practices of other companies, as well in as the job market generally, and we cannot make any guarantee that you will find a job after completing our Nanodegree programs or courses.
  • At this time Udacity does not offer job guarantees. Instead, our focus is on supporting all of our students with their goals, be it finding a new career, a new role, or simply learning a new skill. To accomplish that, students enrolled in a Nanodegree program will have access to the following career resources to help you reach your goals:
    • GitHub, LinkedIn, Resume, Cover Letter Reviews
    • You can read more about our Career Resources here: https://www.udacity.com/school/career-resources

articles.name: Why choose Cloud Engineering?
articles.title: Why choose Cloud Engineering?
articles.body:
It’s raining jobs in the market of cloud and cloud-related services! All the top global companies are moving their functions to cloud-based systems and therefore, cloud engineers are more in demand than ever.

Despite the initial concerns about the privacy and security of cloud, organizations have  started to realize the enormous potential of the platform. As per this Robert Half report, 94% of global managers surveyed have either already started using the cloud services or expect to migrate within the coming three to five years. If this seems like an opportunity that excites you and makes you want to become a successful cloud engineer in 2021, keep reading to know everything about the career opportunities and earning potential in this field.

What Do Cloud Engineer Roles Look Like?

As per  Glassdoors Best 50 Jobs in America for 2021, cloud engineering is one of the top 25 jobs in the list coupled with a job satisfaction rating of 3.9/5. Here’s a sneak peek into some of the common responsibilities of a cloud engineer: 

  • Coordinate with the IT and engineering teams and implement cloud-based solutions
  • Planning, designing and developing cloud-based applications
  • Managing the cloud infrastructure in tandem with the company security guidelines
  • Keeping up-to-date with the latest developments in the industry and taking appropriate initiatives

Is Cloud Engineering a rewarding career?

The average annual salary  for cloud engineers is $115,418 as per Indeed.com. Now this salary obviously varies according to the job profile, geographical location and the organization you work with. 

According to an extensive study done by Business Insider, companies like Google, AWS and Microsoft pay lucrative salaries to hire top talent in this field. Here are some of the amazing opportunities that you can aim for:

  • A Cloud Application Architect at AWS can earn between $140,000 and $150,00
  • A Cloud Solution Architect at Microsoft can pull in anywhere between $89,149 and $183,116. 
  • Recent cloud-related hires at Google include sales engineers and program managers, with salaries ranging from $134,000 to $174,000.
  • Cloud Engineers at Cisco can earn as much as $187,300
  • Cloud Ops Engineers at Citrix can make around $150,000
  • Cloud Developers at VMware can earn $202,982
  • Cloud DevOps Engineers at Lenovo can bring home $163,645

These are some of the highest Paying Companies in the United States for Cloud Engineers:

  • Stanford Healthcare: $229,000
  • Deloitte: $221,674
  • Citrix Systems Inc.: $179,638
  • Selby Jennings: $173,107
  • Epsilon: $168,313

In addition to cloud engineering education, adding critical skills and qualifications like  PPM tools, Informatica, Docker and Drupal can help boost your salary anywhere from 10% – 67%. Additionally, team management is the most recommended skill which can help you earn up to 50% more than the average salary. 

How Can You Become A Cloud Engineer?

There is an exciting eagerness  among business leaders to adopt cloud — public, private or hybrid — to bolster their digital transformation at their organizations. If you want to build a rewarding career in the cloud, do check out our School of Cloud Computing which has various Nanodegree programs to prepare you for various roles like Cloud Developer, Cloud DevOps and even specialized roles like Solutions Architects and Security Engineers. Come on, let’s START LEARNING!

articles.name: Data Science or Machine Learning?
articles.title: Data Science or Machine Learning?
articles.body:
If you’re able to read this article, you are already a part of the modern world running on information and constantly catapulted by technology. So welcome, tech user! Even if you don’t think much about the terms like artificial intelligence, data science, robotics, machine learning, and cybersecurity in your daily life, they are already a huge part of it.

Data science and machine learning engineering are two prominent and evolving tech fields that can offer great salaries and open doors for path breaking and fascinating careers. But what is it that machine learning engineers and data scientists do? Are they almost similar or strikingly different? Keep reading to learn more.

What is the role of a Data Scientist?

Data scientists work with computers, algorithms, and systematic work processes to collect, clean, organize, and analyze data to establish patterns, deduce actionable insights, and find answers to crucial questions in any field of their interest such as: 

  • Stock market metrics
  • Restaurant food inventories
  • Internet website traffic
  • Astronomical solar system surveys
  • Epidemiological disease tracking
  • Population censuses 

Here’s how a typical working day as a data scientist could look like:

  • Collecting, transforming, and analyzing large amounts and/or unique types of data
  • Performing statistical analyses of data
  • Generating visualizations and models from data
  • Composing reports about insights drawn from data
  • Solving business-related questions or problems with data
  • Communicating with fellow professionals about data

What skills do Data Scientists need?

Data scientists can use knowledge, skills, and analytical techniques from an array of subjects like:

  • Applied mathematics: math with application to different disciplines (e.g. physics, engineering, biology)
  • Statistics: math focused on data collection, analysis, interpretation, and representation
  • Information visualization: the study and design of visual representations of knowledge (often interactive) to aid human conceptual understanding
  • Analytics: systematic logical analysis of data and/or statistics
  • Computer science: computing that includes computer design, software development, and information processing
  • Communications: techniques and technologies for transmitting information

Below is a list of computer languages, tools and platforms that enable to data scientists to process data such as:

Computer Programming Languages

  • R
  • Python
  • Julia
  • SQL
  • Scala
  • C++
  • Java

Data Visualization Tools

  • Tableau
  • PowerBI
  • Qlik
  • Sisense
  • Webix

Computing Platforms

  • IBM’s Watson Studio
  • Dataiku
  • Anaconda
  • MATLAB
  • Databricks

What is the role of a Machine Learning Engineer?

Machine learning refers to the design, implementation, and operation of computers with algorithms that can learn and improve on their own! They develop, deploy, and improve software applications and machine learning models that can deduce critical and actionable insights from data.

Here’s how a typical working day as a data scientist could look like:

  • Programming computers using different programming languages
  • Designing and developing machine learning algorithms, data structures, models, and devices
  • Testing machine learning models and software architectures
  • Reviewing machine learning models and devices
  • Composing technical documentation explaining your work
  • Communicating technical concepts with fellow professionals

Machine learning engineers create products that help with the work of other specialists including data scientists and data analysts. With machine learning products, machines and people can process, analyze, learn from, and understand ever-greater amounts of data. As this technology evolves with time, computers would be able to process data in exponentially shorter durations of time. Financial business decisions, operating self-driving cars, or diagnosing diseases are some of the widespread areas where machine learning could be deployed.

Read more about the ins and outs of machine learning engineering.

Which skills do Machine Learning Engineers use?

Machine learning engineers need to be adept in computer and software engineering. Subject areas that inform machine learning include:

  • Mathematics: a broad discipline that includes theoretical and applied study of quantities, structures, and space
  • Computer programming: the process of designing and building computer programs to achieve specific tasks
  • Software engineering: a form of engineering dedicated to software development, operation, and documentation
  • Probability: a branch of mathematics focused on describing the likelihood of an event or truthfulness of a proposition
  • Statistics: math focused on data collection, analysis, interpretation, and representation
  • Data structures: computer science formats for storing, organizing, and managing data that enable users to access and modify the data
  • Algorithms: well-defined computer instructions useful for performing computations or solving problems

There is overlap in the computer programming languages that machine learning engineers and data scientists use; many of those listed above as useful for data science apply to machine learning engineering as well! 

These are some of the additional computing platforms that machine learning engineers use:

  • Microsoft Azure
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Google Cloud
  • IBM Cloud
  • TensorFlow
  • PyTorch

How Much Can You Earn as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer?

According to ZipRecruiter, the  average annual salary for a data scientist is $119,413 in the U.S. in 2021. Salaries could range anywhere between $92,500 (25th percentile) to $164,500 (90th percentile) based on skill sets and experience.

Additionally, according to ZipRecruiter reports, the average annual salary for a machine learning engineer is $130,530 in the U.S. in 2021. Salaries could again range from $103,000 (25th percentile) to $179,000 (90th percentile) based on proficiency and past experience.

Learn With Udacity

We at Udacity offer you multiple Nanodegree programs based on your current skill sets to become proficient in data science and machine learning. Here’s the list you can choose from:

  • Become a Data Scientist
  • Intro to Machine Learning with PyTorch
  • Become a Machine Learning Engineer

Gift yourself a rewarding learning journey in these modern technologies with Udacity! Choose a  relevant Nanodegree program today!

articles.name: Becoming a Self Driving car engineer
articles.title: Becoming a Self Driving car engineer
articles.body:
Are you fascinated by how Tesla cars self drive? Did you hear that Voyage: a self driving startup spun out of our very own Udacity has been acquired by Cruise? If this  news excites you, you’re at the right place! 

The boom in the self driving car industry has presented a juggernaut opportunity for qualified engineers adept in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and self-driving car engineering to innovate and steer this technology forward.

Sebastian Thrun, our founder is an ardent educator and innovator in the self driving space and therefore, we proudly offer educational courses to help our learners get equipped with the best modern skills in this technology at a fraction of Boot Camp fees.

The Self-driving Cars Industry in 2021

According to the Guardian, self driving cars would be the pioneers of driverless transportation in 2020. Despite the rapid pace of pushing boundaries by some great startups, it is evident that this technology is yet to be perfected. 

As per current predictions, the global self driving car market is bound to be worth 60 billion USD by 2030 which is a steep rise from the 2018’s estimation of the industry being worth just 6 billion USD! Therefore, it doesn’t come as a surprise that we are about to witness a decade of rapid advancements in this relatively novel technology which would in turn present marvelous opportunities for skilled innovators and engineers in this space. 

Yes, there is an evident scope of opportunities for self driving car engineers, but the obvious succeeding question here would be the earning potential in this role, right? To be clear and as observed in any professional field, the salaries would rely on the skills, expertise and the roles offered to engineers. The roles could range among research and development, programming machine learning components or building and testing the actual vehicles.  As far as salaries for self-driving car engineers go, these will vary depending on skill level and experience. Some roles may be more focused on research and development, whereas other roles are more focused on the machine learning components or building and testing the actual vehicles which in turn could affect the salaries that would be offered.

Listen to one of Udacity’s rock star self-driving car engineer instructors, David Silver, answer burning questions about the industry.

What Skills Does a Self-Driving Car Engineer Need? 

The expectation for self driving engineers would be to hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical, Mechanical, System, Industrial Engineering, Robotics or related fields. Also, the engineers would be expected to be proficient in Python or C++ along with Linux. They should be able to write concise, maintainable and extensible codes and navigate lengthy codebases.

Apart from these educational requirements, employers tend to recruit skilled  with relevant practical experience. Past experience in software engineering, machine learning, distributed machine learning and distributed computing would be a huge plus for candidates looking to get hired. Additionally, skills in autonomous driving, testing of control and estimation algorithms, traffic simulation would be desirable skills for potential candidates.

Talking about general competencies, strong verbal, written and interpersonal skills, curiosity and being a team player would definitely always be plus points.

Driving Into a New Career Path!

If this above discussion ignites the passion in you to become a top self driving engineer, here is we at Udacity can help you achieve this goal. You can get the best industry relevant skill sets by enrolling in Udacity Self-Driving Car Engineer Nanodegree Program. In this Nanodegree  program, you will learn how to apply computer vision and deep learning to automotive problems, like detecting lane lines, predicting steering angles and much more. You’ll also get to learn sensor fusion to efficiently filter relevant data from an array of multiple sensors in order to perceive and navigate your car’s environment. Finally, you’ll have an exciting opportunity to run your code in a simulation on Udacity’s very own self-driving car, Carla! Click here to know more about the detailed syllabus of this program. So what are you waiting for! Click here to enroll and START LEARNING!

articles.name: Verifying your ID for graduation
articles.title: Verifying your ID for graduation
articles.body:
In order to process your graduation, ID Verification is required to receive your certificate. You will be prompted to verify your ID during the graduation process upon completing your Nanodegree program, Executive program and single-paid course.

Requirements

During ID verification, you’ll need to provide:

  • A clear and full image of your valid, government issued photo ID
  • A clear image of your face

Acceptable types of IDs you can use during the verification process include:

  • Passport
  • Driver's license
  • Government issued ID Card

We cannot verify IDs that are:

  • Expired
  • Photocopied or Digital Copy
  • Not issued by a government
  • Blocked information
  • Black & white images
  • Manipulated
  • Files bigger than 8 MB
  • PDF files

When you submit your ID information, we make sure your information is secure. Learn more about Udacity’s use of your data and privacy practices here and Jumio’s Privacy Policy here. Also learn about Jumio’s security practices here.

The ID Verification usually takes a few minutes, but occasionally can take up to 24 hours to process. Once Netverify verifies your ID, your graduation page will be updated and you can see the results by refreshing your page.

Troubleshoot ID Verification

If your ID Verification runs into any issues, you may need to retry the process with new images or a different ID. The system will provide an opportunity to try again. Please be sure:

  • You are in a well-lit area 
  • Do not obstruct your ID with your fingers
  • There is no blur or glare in your ID photo
  • Your images are clear and in color

Images upload issues

If you are experiencing difficulties and can't upload images, try:

  • Updating your current device or browser
  • Using a different browser or incognito window
  • Uploading a .png or .jpg that’s less than 1 MB
  • Using the mobile device path, which will provide you with a link to use your mobile device camera

articles.name: Launching AWS from the classroom
articles.title: Launching AWS from the classroom
articles.body:
Students will have the option to launch the AWS console if they are enrolled in a program that includes AWS usage.

How to launch the AWS Console in your Udacity Classroom

If you are enrolled in an AWS eligible Nanodegree program, follow the steps below to launch AWS from the classroom:

  1. Sign in to your Udacity account
  2. Click on your program card from the classroom dashboard and navigate to the relevant lesson.
  3. On the lesson page, locate the Cloud Resources tab, as shown below. 
  4. Under Cloud Resources, select the Open Cloud Console button to launch your AWS console
    • Please note: This may take a few moments to load. If you have a pop-up blocker installed, it may prevent the new tab from launching. Please be sure to allow pop-ups from Udacity.

Best Practices to Avoid Unexpected AWS Charges

Check out this article for best practices to avoid unexpected AWS charges.

articles.title: Switching/changing your current Nanodegree program

articles.name: Editing your payment method
articles.title: Editing your payment method
articles.body:
You can edit your payment method to a different credit or debit card or payment option.

To change your payment method:

  1. Sign in to your Udacity account
  2. Click the Account Name button in the top right-hand corner of your classroom view
  3. Click Subscription settings from the dropdown menu

  5. Enter the new card's information

​​

 

​

articles.name: Changing your personal information (email, name, phone number)
articles.title: Changing your personal information (email, name, phone number)
articles.body:
You can change your personal information such as your First and Last name, Phone Number, and Email from your profile settings. To access your personal profile settings, click the Name icon on the top right corner of your classroom homepage.

Please keep in mind that you cannot change your email to an email address that is currently linked to another Udacity account.
